intro: Stillingia campestris, commonly known as field stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Stillingia campestris is typically found in open fields, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils.
